wakeModel module¶

  • University of Stavanger

  • Hui Cheng (PhD student)

  • Lin Li (Medveileder)

  • Prof. Muk Chen Ong (Supervisor)

Any questions about this code, please email: hui.cheng@uis.no

A module that can be use to deal with net to net wake effect.

In order to use this module, we recommend import net2netwake as wake in the beginning of your code. Please refer to Cheng et al. (2020) [https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aquaeng.2020.102070] for details.

class wakeModel.net2net(model_index, node_initial_position, hydro_element, current_velocity, origin, dw0, net_solidity)¶

Bases: object

A module that can be use to deal with net to net wake effect.

Note

Can only apply to a single fish cage or two net panel.

Parameters

  • model_index – [string] Unit: [-]. To indicate the model function, e.g.: ‘factor-0.9’, ‘loland-0.5’, ‘hui-1’.

  • node_initial_position – [np.array].shape=(N,3) Unit: [m]. The initial coordinates of N nodes in cartesian coordinate system.

  • hydro_element – [list] Unit: [-]. A python list to indicate how the lines are connected.

  • current_velocity – [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of three values Unit: [m/s]. The current velocity [ux,uy,uz] in cartesian coordinate system.

  • origin – [np.array].shape=(1,3) or a [list] of three values Unit: [m]. The origin [x,y,z] for detecting the elements in the wake region. For a fish cage, the origin is usually sit in the floating collar.

  • dw0 – [float] Unit: [m]. The diameter of the physical net twines.

  • net_solidity – [float] Unit: [-]. The solidity of netting.

cal_factor1()¶

A private function calculate the flow reduction factor according to Loland (1991). r=1-0.14*CD (CD is the input value in the `wakeModel`)

Returns

Flow reduction factor: [float] Unit [-].

cal_factor2(alf)¶

A private function calculate the flow reduction factor according to Hui et al., (2020).

Parameters

alf – [float] Unit [rad]. Definition: the angle between normal vector of a net panel and the flow direction.

Returns

Flow reduction factor: [float] Unit [-].

get_element_in_wake()¶

A private function to go go through all the elements and find the elements in the wake region.

Returns

[List] Unit [-]. A list of “indexes of the elements” in the wake region.

is_element_in_wake(one_element)¶

A private function to tell if an element is in wake region or not.

Parameters

one_element – [List] of three values Unit [-]. A list to contain the index of nodes in one element. The list should contain at least two values.

Returns

True if the element in the wave region.

reduction_factor(element_index, alpha=0)¶

A public function to return the flow reduction factor according to the index of element (and inflow angle).

Parameters

  • element_index – [integer] Unit [-]. A index of element

  • alpha – [float] Unit [rad]. Default value=0; The inflow angle of the net panel.

Returns

[float] Unit [-]. Range [0,1] Flow reduction factor. If value=1, the flow is no change. If value is 0, the flow is reduced to zero.
